image.altText: A picture of the entry sign to the Port Augusta Courthouse

props.synopsis: A Port Augusta resident's attempt to charge several government officials and his local council with more than 350 criminal offences using an archaic concept of common law has been tossed out by court.Â

title.children: SA man uses archaic common law to charge local council with over 350 offences

image.altText: Algal bloom foam on rocks

props.synopsis: SA government officials say there are some positive signs around the toxic algal bloom crisis as it continues to affect the state's metropolitan beaches.

title.children: SA government 'cautiously optimistic' about toxic algal bloom

image.altText: SA Ambulance generic

props.synopsis: A young girl has died almost a week after she was rushed to hospital following a serious crash involving a ute and a van on the northern outskirts of Adelaide.

title.children: Six-year-old girl dies in hospital after crash north of Adelaide

image.altText: man in suit smiling next to man in sports jacket with grey hair in golf buggy

props.synopsis: Premier Peter Malinauskas has rejected suggestions his government's North Adelaide golf course redevelopment is a risky investment with LIV Golf losing hundreds of millions a year, as he revealed where the Saudi-backed tournament will be hosted in 2027.

title.children: LIV Golf's losses will not put $50m course in doubt, SA premier says

image.altText: A medium sized green sea turtle lies in sand with seaweed around it.

props.synopsis: A walker says Adelaide Zoo's care for an injured sea turtle he rescued from Moana beach is a small sign of hope amid the destruction of South Australia's algal bloom.

title.children: Claude the turtle's survival provides glimmer of hope amid algal bloom

image.altText: An SES volunteer in orange overalls walks across grassland towards a row of SES and police vehicles

props.synopsis: An expert in artificial intelligence says a fake image depicting missing four-year-old Gus being abducted in South Australia's outback highlights the dangerous link between AI and the spread of misinformation.

title.children: Expert says AI-generated image of missing boy Gus case raises serious concerns

image.altText: An elderly man in a navy blue jumper standing with his arms crossed in front of a building

props.synopsis: While a government-funded medical clinic is set to reopen, residents in SA's second biggest city are still struggling to access local care.

title.children: Patients travel hours from SA city to see a GP as shortage persists

image.altText: A close up of a surfboard showing clear bite marks.

props.synopsis: A man who witnessed the "extraordinary" moment a surfer was bitten by a shark chasing a seal offshore Kangaroo Island has spoken to the ABC after his footage circulated online.

title.children: 'Always go surfing with a doctor': Shark attack witness shares 'extraordinary' moment

image.altText: THUMB: Map project energyconnect

props.synopsis: Touted as a model for the energy transition, a "quick and easy" high-voltage powerline project linking South Australia directly to New South Wales is running dramatically over time and over budget.

title.children: 'Extension cord to nowhere' looms large as Australiaâs energy transition evolves

image.altText: A man stares into the lens

props.synopsis: A Kangaroo Island brewer says he will no longer supply beer to the island's ferry service, amid a growing outcry over the high cost of fares to the popular international tourism destination.Â

title.children: Brewer stages beer boycott over Kangaroo Island ferry's 'ridiculous' fares

image.altText: A line of school children, including one wearing a red bike helmet and another holding a grey bag

props.synopsis: The quake hit in the Mindanao region at a depth of 62 kilometres below ground level and could cause hazardous tsunami waves along coasts within 300km of the epicentre, seismology authorities say.

title.children: Evacuations, tsunami warnings after magnitude-7.4 Philippines earthquake

image.altText: A disability facility in suburban Adelaide.

props.synopsis: An audit has revealed an Adelaide aged care facility was inappropriately using restraints on patients, raising the question of whether the state government has learned from the Oakden aged care scandal in 2017.

title.children: Has the SA government learned from the Oakden aged care scandal?

image.altText: An aerial view of Pumicestone Passage showing the new and old channels between the passage and the ocean.

props.synopsis: A deadly parasite that has laid waste to bee colonies throughout Australia has so far not made it to Kangaroo Island, home to the world's oldest bee sanctuary.

title.children: Scramble to protect island bee colony from parasitic killer

image.altText: A plane on the runway with people standing around

props.synopsis: Passengers have praised the actions of the pilot and cabin crew after a Rex aircraft was evacuated at Adelaide Airport this morning following a fire emergency.Â

title.children: Rex flight evacuated after engine catches fire at Adelaide Airport

image.altText: Shaun de Bruyn stands in a grassed area wearing a white shirt and navy suit

props.synopsis: Tourism, seafood industry and community representatives are calling for greater funding, education and travel incentives ahead of the release of the South Australian government's upcoming Summer Plan.

title.children: Tourism operators facing 'dire straits' without more algal bloom relief

image.altText: Donna Nelson eating an icecream, wearing a crochet top.

props.synopsis: A Perth grandmother duped into becoming a drug mule in an elaborate love scam abandons her final line of appeal on drug importing charges in Japan.

title.children: Grandmother duped into becoming drug mule aborts fight against Japan sentence

image.altText: Graphic showing the Schengen area, a visa application clipboard and a passport with European Union flag.

props.synopsis: Facial scans and fingerprinting will replace passport stamps across 29 countries in the Schengen Zone from October 12.

title.children: Travellers heading to Europe warned of long delays after new entry rules

image.altText: Two Filipino women walking past a damaged, swaying white building and concrete rubble, and a yellow crime tape

props.synopsis: The quake hit in the Mindanao region at a depth of 62 kilometres below ground level and could cause hazardous tsunami waves along coasts within 300km of the epicentre, seismology authorities say.

title.children: Two dead after magnitude-7.4 Philippines earthquake

image.altText: Sanae Takaichi walking on stage

props.synopsis: Japan's Komeito party on Friday said it would quit its coalition with the Liberal Democratic Party (LDP). Its departure could trigger an unwinding of the so-called "Takaichi trade", which had been driven by investor optimism around fiscal stimulus.

title.children: Japan's ruling coalition splits, throwing Takaichi's PM bid into doubt

image.altText: Family of ducks cross busy freeway causing six-car crash

props.synopsis: Six cars are caught in a pile-up as a family of ducks attempts to cross busy Kwinana Freeway during the morning peak hour in Perth.

title.children: Family of ducks crossing Perth freeway cause peak-hour pile up

image.altText: Paul Scarr stands in the Senate.

props.synopsis: Shadow Immigration Minister Paul Scarr has called for a "measured and considered" debate over migration levels after incendiary comments by members of the party's right flank.

title.children: Coalition frontbencher tries to reframe migration policy debate

image.altText: a skyline with houses

props.synopsis: RBA Governor Michele Bullock says the federal government's First Home Guarantee scheme could see some Australians taking out riskier loans. Â

title.children: RBA governor says First Home Guarantee could lead to riskier loans

image.altText: A man in a cream suit walks down a footpath with another woman

props.synopsis: Brittany Higgins's husband David Sharaz is served bankruptcy papers by former Senator Linda Reynolds, as she tries to recover damages awarded to her by a Perth court for defamation.

title.children: David Sharaz served bankruptcy papers by Linda Reynolds

image.altText: Devonport collapsed tree

props.synopsis: Two people have died after a tree fell on them on a rural property in Tasmania's north-west, amid severe winds and wet weather, police say.

title.children: Two dead after tree falls in Tasmanian wild weather

image.altText: Taylor Swift in a provocative outfit of jewels with red lipstick and finger in mouth.

props.synopsis: The star's 12th album's sales success has come despite the mixed reception it received from critics and fans.

title.children: Swift breaks Adele's album sales record despite mixed reception

image.altText: A female in a doctor's uniform stands with a stethoscope around her neck.

props.synopsis: Patients may not see the benefits of higher bulk billing for years, and average-out-of-pocket costs are expected to rise, the health department has conceded â despite $8.5 billion being tipped into the GP subsidy scheme from November.

title.children: Patients may not see benefits of $8.5bn bulk billing boost for four years

image.altText: A middle-aged black woman stands behind a podium in front of an American flag.

props.synopsis: New York Attorney General Letitia James, a longtime foe of US President Donald Trump, is indicted for bank fraud.Â

title.children: Letitia James, NY attorney general and Trump foe, indicted for bank fraud

image.altText: CCTV video of man about to attack blonde woman on street.

props.synopsis: Emma Van Der Hoek had only just moved to London from Sydney when her phone was stolen. She was inspired to do something about it.Â

title.children: In the world's 'phone theft capital', one Aussie decides to fight back

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Jim Chalmers QT

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says his request for Treasury to examine a controversial proposal to lift taxes on some superannuation balances is "nothing unusual", rejecting claims he is planning to rewrite it.

title.children: PM says 'nothing unusual' about Treasury meeting on super tax

image.altText: A woman of asian appearance looking at mail while standing in front of letter boxes

props.synopsis: Even years after moving in, you might still be receiving someone elseâs bills and letters. Hereâs what can you do about it.Â

title.children: Can you ever throw out a previous home owner or renter's mail?

props.synopsis: Researchers mapping millions of trees as part of a climate change study think they have found Australia's tallest rainforest tree.

title.children: At 77 metres, is this hoop pine Australia's tallest rainforest tree?

image.altText: Brodie Kostecki stands in the

props.synopsis: Brodie Kostecki looks a strong chance to become the third driver to claim three consecutive Bathurst 1000 poles after going fastest in Friday's qualifying session.

title.children: Kostecki sets record to snare Bathurst provisional pole

image.altText: Charlie Curnow pumps his right fist during Carlton's AFL win over Essendon.

props.synopsis: The chase for Carlton star Charlie Curnow heated up on day five of the AFL trade period, with Geelong seeing an offer rejected as Sydney prepared its bid.

title.children: Blues secure two deals as Swans and Cats prepare for Curnow battle

image.altText: A composite image of two boys, one in a white shirt and one in a collared shirt and dark puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: Two teenagers charged with murder after the deaths of Dau Akueng and Chol Achiek have refused to board the prison van to attend court.

title.children: Teens charged with murder after deaths of Melbourne boys refuse to attend court

image.altText: A plane crashed on the ground with emergency services surrounding it.

props.synopsis: The Russian president makes his first public admission of responsibility for the crash, in an effort to improve relations with Azerbaijan.

title.children: Putin says Russian air defences were to blame for Azerbaijani plane crash
